message:
गुरु गोविंद दोनों खड़े, काके लागूं पाँय । 
बलिहारी गुरु आपनो, गोविंद दियो मिलाय ॥
"If God and my Teacher were to stand before me, who would I first greet?
I will choose my Teacher; for it was through his teachings that I saw God."
Man is nothing without knowledge and there is no knowledge without a teacher. From our parents who teach us the basic art of living in this world to our teachers and professors who give us the knowledge imperative to suceed in our lives,we find different teachers in different spans of our lives.
Students' Alumni Cell wishes all those teachers a Happy Teachers' Day.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavors to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to be implemented in near future to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 47 new photos.
message: “Home is where the heart is.” Homecoming 2018, organised by Students’ Alumni Cell from 17th-19th August, was an exciting journey for our esteemed alumni of the batches of 1998, 2003 and 2008. Touring the enormous campus they once called home, visiting their halls and academic shrines was an enriching experience for them. Winds of nostalgia blew as they walked the streets of 2.2, enjoyed good food and hung out with their buddies in all the popular campus spots. The various events planned kept them entertained all day long. It truly was a wonderful stay!

"Here in the place of that Hijli Detention Camp stands this fine monument of India to-day representing India’s urges, India’s future in the making. This picture seems to me symbolical of the changes that are coming to India."

A lot of us owe what we are today to this wondrous place and it is a matter of immense pride to be associated with this pristine Institution which has grown by leaps and bounds over the last 68 Years. Kgp, we will be forever indebted to you.

It's never too late to unleash the child within you and hence, Students' Alumni Cell is organising Art Attack in association with Spectra. This is a painting competition to be held in Bhatnagar Auditorium (F116) from 5 PM onwards for both students and Alumni! Students have to bring their own paint while the sheets for the painting will be provided by us.
So, come and enjoy an evening full of colours!

जिंदगी सिलसिला, आज कल की नहीं।
मैं जी भर जिया, मैं मन से मरूं,
लौटकर आऊंगा, कूच से क्यों डरूं?"

We are hiring!

Lead Front End & Back End Engineers to work on the architecture level of the product. 
Apply Here: https://angel.co/medcords/jobs

MedCords is a health tech company aiming to make health care accessible and effective with organized and comprehensive medical information & Build predictive intelligence to reduce health risks for 1.3bn people in India, 70% of which reside in rural areas. The platform securely stores medical records and provides users easy access anytime and anywhere, currently focusing on rural India.  The cloud-based platform has been designed to cater to every citizen who has a phone connection. 

We have over 3.5lakh patients onboard with us across 1800 villages from four districts in Rajasthan. We are backed by a VC & are also working under the Rajasthan Govt. iStart initiative.

The founders are IIT-Bombay & BITS Pilani alum and have a very strong knowledge of the industry with a combined experience of around 15 years. We're currently present in Rajasthan and Pune (Tech Office). 

Read more about us: https://yourstory.com/2018/08/medical-records-anytime-anywhere-kota-based-medcords-cloud-solution

We have over 3.5lakh patients onboard with us across 1800 villages from four districts in Rajasthan. We are backed by a VC & are also working under the Rajasthan Govt. iStart initiative.

The founders are IIT-Bombay & BITS Pilani alum and have a very strong knowledge of the industry with a combined experience of around 15 years. We're currently present in Rajasthan and Pune (Tech Office). 

Read more about us: https://yourstory.com/2018/08/medical-records-anytime-anywhere-kota-based-medcords-cloud-solution

So save the dates: 17th-19th August

Want to contact alumni but dont know what to do? Well, have no fears because Students' Alumni Cell is here! When it comes to the basics of networking, we've got you completely covered. From developing the perfect linkedin profile to making the first call, we'll teach you everything you need to know to harness the immense power of the IITian network. story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added a new photo — with Sanket.
message:
Sanket

Students’ Alumni Cell is forever indebted to its seniors who have been the pillars on which this organisation has stood strong and grown over the years. They will always continue to inspire us to be better at what we do and uphold the legacy and values that makes us what we are today. Thank you very much Sanket for being one of the guiding forces for us and giving us a direction.

Alumni of IIT Kharagpur have time and again made us proud by reaching great heights. Their stories are an inspiration to every Kgpian and we take honour in bringing to you their achievements and their road to success.

Swami Smaranananda Giri | EC, 1980 | JCB

Swami Smaranananda Giri did his PhD from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering in 1980. He is the General Secretary of the Yogoda Satsanga Society of India, founded by Sri Paramahansa Yogananda in 1917. He was a Gold Medalist in School Final and in Engineering. He served at IIT Kharagpur as a Senior Research Assistant, at Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, Hyderabad as a Design Engineer, at Siddhardha Engineering College, Vijayawada as an Assistant Professor, at Concordia University, Montreal, Canada as a Post-Doctoral Fellow, and at the Centre for Navigational Electronics, Osmania University, Hyderabad as a Senior Scientist. In 1985 Swami Smaranananda was to decide whether to join the former President of India Dr. Abdul Kalam in his missile project as a Scientist or Yogoda Satsanga Ashram as a sannyasi, and chose the latter. Based in Ranchi, Jharkhand, Swami Smaranananda has spoken extensively on the teachings of Paramahansa Yoganandaji at various universities and institutions throughout India and abroad.

Narayan B Mandayam | EE, 1989 | NH

Dr. Narayan B Mandayam is a Distinguished Professor in the Department of ECE at Rutgers University. He received the B.Tech (Hons.) degree in 1989 from IIT KGP and the M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in 1991 and 1994 from Rice University, Houston, TX, all in electrical engineering. He was a visiting faculty fellow in the Department of Electrical Engineering, Princeton University in Fall 2002 and a visiting faculty at the Indian Institute of Science in Spring 2003. His work is mainly based on system modeling and performance, and signal processing. Dr. Mandayam was felicitated with the Institute Silver Medal at IIT KGP and has won many other accolades ever since, including the Peter D. Cherasia Faculty Scholar Award from Rutgers University (2010) and the National Science Foundation CAREER Award in 1998.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Principal Dav Iit Kgp and 15 others.
message:
Alumni of IIT Kharagpur have time and again made us proud by reaching great heights. Their stories are an inspiration to every Kgpian and we take honour in bringing to you their achievements and their road to success.

Sudipta Seal | MT, 1990 | RK

Dr. Sudipta Seal completed his B.Tech for the Department of Metallurgical and Materials Engineering in 1990. He joined the Advanced Materials Processing and Analysis Center (AMPAC) and Materials Science & Engineering at the University of Central Florida in 1997. He has consistently contributed to UCF in research, instruction and service since 1998. He has served as Nano Initiative Coordinator for the Vice-President of Research & Commercialization. He is currently a Professor and Chair of Materials Science and Engineering. His outstanding research has developed surface engineered nanoscale transition metal and rare earth oxide ceramics for catalysis, energetics and nano-biomedicine. He has developed scalable methods for template free nano oxide particles.

V Narayanan | CR (MTech: 1990), AE(PhD: 2001) | VS, GH

Dr. V Narayanan did his MTech in the field of Cryogenics (with the first rank) and then went on to complete his Ph.D. from the department of aerospace engineering in 2001 from IIT Kharagpur. He was also awarded Honorary Degree of Doctor of Science by Sathyabama University, Chennai in the year 2017. An outstanding scientist, he took over as the Director of Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre on 22nd January 2018. Dr. Narayanan is a Fellow of Indian National Academy of Engineering (FINAE) and Member of Space Propulsion Committee of International Astronautical Federation (IAF). He fought his way up to the top and is an inspiration to many today.

Ramesh Jain | ECE, 1975 (Ph.D.) | BCR

A graduate of Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, Dr. Ramesh Jain completed his Ph.D. in ECE in 1975. He is a scientist and entrepreneur in the field of information and computer science and has founded and directed several AI and Visual Information Systems labs. In 2005 he was named the first Bren Professor in Information and Computer Science for the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences, University of California, Irvine. Startup companies such as Imageware, Virage, Praja, and Seraja are proof of his entrepreneurial prowess. His current research is in Future Health, Social Life Networks, and Visual Web and he is founding director of the UCI Institute for Future Health (IFH).

Santanu Chaudhary | EC (BTech: 1984), CS (PhD: 1989) | RP

Dr. Santanu Chaudhary completed his B.Tech in Electronics and Electrical Communication in 1984 and his Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering in 1989 from IIT Kharagpur. He is the author/co-author of 259 research publications in the leading national and international journals. He was conferred with the INSA (Indian National Science Academy) medal for Young Scientists in 1993 and was awarded the ACCS-CDAC award for Research Contribution in 2012. He served as the Dean (UGS) at IIT Delhi from 2009-2012. He is currently the Director of CSIR- Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute. His research interests include image processing, embedded systems, and machine learning.

Parag Havaldar | CS, 1991 | LLR

Parag Havaldar completed his BTech in Computer Science and Engineering in 1991 from IIT KGP and went on to complete his PhD in computer vision and graphics from the University of Southern California in 1996. Currently he is a Software R&D Lead at Blizzard Entertainment.
Mr. Havaldar has been the fulcrum of research and development teams on Hollywood hits like The Polar Express, Alice in Wonderland, and The Amazing Spider Man series, working with some of the most legendary trailblazers in Hollywood such as Academy Award winner Robert Zemeckis and two-time Academy Award nominee Tim Burton. He is the recipient of the Academy Award for Technical Achievements and was honoured for the development of expression-based facial performance-capture technology at Sony Pictures Imageworks.

Haresh Lalvani | AR, 1967 | RP

A graduate of Department of Architecture and Regional Planning, Dr. Lalvani completed his PhD. from the University of Pennsylvania. He has centred his career around the intersection of architecture, nature and higher mathematics and has devoted himself to understanding the elemental principles underlying natural and artificial form. Currently a professor of Architecture at Pratt University, he is also the co-director of the Center for Experimental Structures there. He received the Pioneers' Award from the Space Structures Research Center, University of Surrey, UK and has designed the award-winning Project X, a luxury apartment high-rise in Manhattan. From his challenging Metapuzzles to his discovery of Hyper-Geodesic Structures, he has combined his love for art and mathematics to generate new languages of design.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message: Beachside barbeque, groovy music, awesome company - one cannot think of a better evening. We are proud to announce that Students' Alumni Meet, Singapore was nothing short of perfection. The joint efforts of Students' Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur, IIT Alumni Association Singapore and SPARC made this event a grand success. All the students and alumni had the most amazing time and we look forward to conducting more such international events bringing together the student and alumni communities.

With just 40 days to go, KGP is gearing up to welcome back the class of 1998, 2003 and 2008 back home.
So register at the link given below and let yourself be colored by nostalgia.

Registration link: http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.in/Alumniweb/GoThroughFeatured?feat_id=3

She is currently a professor at Arizona State University and has received the 2013 Distinguished ECE Alumni Award from the ECE Department at the University of Maryland, College Park, and the Fulton Exemplar Faculty Award in 2014 and 2015. She is a Fellow of the IEEE.

Pushpak Bhattacharyya | EE, 1984 | RP 

A highly recognized researcher, Dr. Pushpak Bhattacharyya earned his B.Tech degree form IIT Kharagpur in 1984 and M.Tech degree from IIT Kanpur in 1986. He did his PhD from IIT Bombay in 1994. Well known for his contributions to the field of natural language processing, he served as the President of Association of Computational Linguistics (ACL), the international apex body in NLP (2016-17). He has won several accolades for his contribution to Computer Science and is currently the Director of IIT Patna.

Students’ Alumni Cell is delighted to let you know that we are all set to take a step ahead and grab the brass ring of growth to take our activities global. The first ever Student Alumni Meet, Singapore is to be held on a PAN IIT level on the 7th of July, 2018. Taking our initiatives international and bringing together students and alumni across the world to give them a platform to interact and relish their KGP days gives us great joy and we hope that through your support and active participation this event becomes a grand success. If you are in Singapore then don’t wait as this opportunity doesn’t come knocking your door every day! Register right now at https://goo.gl/forms/8DRtjpUtf8sxFUjh2

As time snapped its fingers and the yearbook portal started disappearing, it was a sad moment for us. It started saying, "I don't want to go Dearest Graduating Students." And since KGP isn't as grim as Infinity Wars we complied to the request of an overwhelming number of graduating students asking for the extension of deadline. So the Yearbook Portal will now close on 18th June 2018. Keep uploading captions and testimonials for your friends by logging in at http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac.in/yearbook/

Hi,

I write to you on behalf of Dyson India.

Dyson, the UK-based global technology company founded by British inventor and entrepreneur, Sir James Dyson, has opened entries for the James Dyson Award (JDA 2018), giving students of the engineering/ product design/ industrial design verticals a unique opportunity to showcase their problem solving inventions on a global stage. 

The James Dyson Award made its debut in India last year, where three Indian entries Maattam, Eco-friendly Faucet and Saviour  made it to the international top 20 shortlist.  Of these, Asish Mohandas, Creator, Maattam was recognized as the national winner for India in 2017. The JDA runs in 27 countries and encourages young engineers to develop problem solving inventions that challenge convention. 

The competition brief is as simple as - design something that solves a problem. The important thing is that the solution is effective and well-thought through. A national winner along with four runners up are chosen from every country to compete for the International winner award in the final stage. The international winners will gain a prize amount of Rs. 26,00,000 (and Rs. 4,00,000 for their university), Rs. 4,00,000 will be awarded to two international runners-up and each national winner will receive Rs.1,70,000. The students can submit their entries by midnight GMT (5:30 AM IST) on 20 July, 2018. 

Candidates can apply through an online application via the James Dyson Award website. The Entrants should concisely explain what their invention is, how it works, and their development process with imagery to support their application. The best entrants should be able to show evidence of physical prototyping as well as sketches and CAD.  The candidates must be, or have been within the last four years, enrolled for at least one semester in an undergraduate or graduate engineering or design program at a university in a country or region chosen to participate in the James Dyson Award. In the case of team entries, all members of the team must be, or have been within the last four years, enrolled for at least one semester in an undergraduate or graduate program at a university in a country or region chosen to participate in the James Dyson Award. One will need to be nominated and registered as the team member.

We would like to extend an invitation to the students of your esteemed institution to participate in the James Dyson Award, and help recognize and support some of the brightest minds in the country. We would be happy to provide you with materials like posters and flyers should you require them to further spread awareness within your premises about this program. 

I look forward to hearing from you soon. 

About Dyson
Dyson was founded in 1993 by Sir James Dyson, who remains at the helm of the company.  From its beginnings in cyclonic vacuums, Dyson’s portfolio has grown to include battery enabled and autonomous vacuum cleaners, hair dryers, lighting, heating and cooling fans, humidifiers, air purifiers and hand dryers, which are exported from the UK and sold in 83 markets globally. Dyson holds 7,500 patents worldwide and is focused on combining hardware, software and algorithms to make intelligent machines which understand their environment and how to improve it.

Headquartered in Malmesbury, UK, Dyson is a family business employing 10,000 people globally. One third of its people are engineers and scientists. Dyson has 40 live university partnerships developing early stage technologies, including a joint robotics lab with Imperial College London, and a Chair of Fluid Mechanics at University of Cambridge. Dyson has pledged £2.5bn to the development of a battery electric vehicle which it will reveal in 2020.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message: The existence of problems should never be the most daunting inhibition, because it sources the biggest motivation for better days. With high spirits and an unstoppable will to enhance the stay of fellow Kgpians, we have successfully raised funds from our Alumni for the much needed, fully equipped ambulance. It's a great feeling to have someone who cares for us and IIT Kharagpur is proud to have alumni who are always ready to carry it on their shoulders. We'd like to thank IITKGP Foundation USA for their support.

It's a great feeling to have someone who cares for us and IIT Kharagpur is proud to have alumni who are always ready to carry it on their shoulders. We'd like to thank IITKGP Foundation USA for their support.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Siddharth Kannan and 9 others.
message:
Students’ Alumni Cell is an organisation that has always been defined by the people and their contribution to it. SAC couldn’t have scaled new heights without you and being one of the pillars on which this family stands so proudly, you will be missed dearly. It’s difficult to see you leave but all of us at SAC couldn’t have been prouder of your achievements and we hope to see you reach the pinnacle of success. SAC will be the wind beneath your wings. Always.

Au revoir ❤️

Congratulations Graduating Students!
Now that it is time to embark on a new adventure, we hope you don't forget your first home away from home . As you leave the campus, you can leave your imprint on it. This symbol of yours will always remind everyone of how "Machau" your batch was. So, under the initiative of My Imprint, sign up to donate your caution money to the institute and be a part of the biggest imprint you leave on the campus.

Kgp is a magic ride for all of us. It is a mixed bag of happiness, despair, and wonders. It has never failed to Stupefy all those who have set foot here and we hope this journey has been as fantastic as Alice’s adventures down the Rabbit Hole, as magical as Harry’s stay at Hogwarts and as adventurous as Bilbo’s quest for the ring that ‘rules them all’ for the entire graduating batch. With this journey slowly coming to its end for the Class of 2018, we’d like to fill up your treasure trove of memories with the best moments of your college life. So all the Harrys, Rons and Hermiones out there, dress up as anyone and anything you like on the 28th of April and grace the Bidhan Chowk with your presence from 4:30 PM onwards. Be a superhero from the Marvel Universe or a God from Mythology or simply a Holiday Armadillo. Anything or anyone. 

P.S.: Be ready to sway to the beats of the Class Song of 2018 ❤️

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 9 new photos.
message:
We thank the Graduating Batch of 2018 for the lovely memories made during ALVIDA on 12th April, 2018. This experience is something which all of us would cherish for the rest of our lives.
So hereby we bring you some of the most memorable moments, right from giving away of the batch awards, unveiling trailer of the Class Song to the Farewell Dinner framed into pictures to be enjoyed with friends and family. 
We wish all of you good luck for your future and hope you make the whole Country proud, just the way you made KGP proud of you.

It always is harder to be left behind than to be the one to go. Bidding goodbye can be hard but let's make this one memorable! Students’ Alumni Cell in association with Technology Alumni Association welcomes the graduating batch of 2018 to ALVIDA. We invite the entire graduating batch to be there at V2 for unveiling trailer of the Class Song, giving away of batch awards and the Farewell dinner.

Date : 12th April, 2018
Time : 7:30 PM onwards
Venue : V2, Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur
*Coupons for dinner will be served from 7:30-8:00 at V2. Hope to see you all there!

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
These few years whizzed past in a jiffy. In these years all of us meet such amazing people in campus whom we call by various names, sometimes funny and sometimes flattering. So here is the Awards for the Class of 2018. Vote for the person who you think is the most suited for the title by logging into the yearbook2k18 portal. Vote quickly! The results will be announced in Alvida on the 12th of April.

Login at www.sac.iitkgp.ac.in/yearbook/ us ing your Roll number and DOB.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Raju Ganesh and 4 others.
message:
Samsung has launched a Student Purchase Program, offering discounted products to students from premier institutes across the world. Students’ Alumni Cell has collaborated with Samsung and taken an initiative to implement this scheme for the students of IIT Kharagpur under its Affinity Programme which will soon expand for the alumni. 

As part of the program, IIT Kharagpur students can purchase Samsung products at great discounted prices. The process to be followed is as follows:

1. Visit Samsung Official Online Store https://shop.samsung.com/in/byod/

2. Login with the official college email Id (@iitkgp.ac.in)

3. Enter OTP sent to college email ID

Apart from great pricing, there are multiple other benefits offered as part of the program.

Dear friends,

I had the opportunity to work hand-in-hand with the CM's Office and District Administration as a CMGGA the last year. It has been an enriching and rewarding journey for me as I have witnessed my ideas shaping up and impacting people. I would highly recommend everyone of this Programme. Do apply!

The Chief Minister’s Good Governance Associates Programme (CMGGA) invites young and enthusiastic aspirants to work with the State Government of Haryana for a year to improve state-wide transparency & efficiency in service delivery. To apply, visit http://bit.ly/CMGGA18

First Deadline: 7th April, 2018

Second Deadline: 15th April, 2018

(Applicants will be shortlisted on rolling basis. The earlier you apply, the sooner you hear.)

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur's post. Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur recognizes the professional achievements and contribution of its alumni through the Distinguished Alumnus Award (DAA) each year on the Annual Convocation Day. You are requested to help us identify the Distinguished Alumnus for this year by nominating those, who in your opinion should be considered for these Awards. Kindly get the nomination form filled up and submitted to the Office of the undersigned latest by 31st March 2018, Saturday A soft copy of the nomination form should also be submitted by email to deanaa@hijli.iitkgp.ernet.in. For more information: http://www.iitkgp.ac.in/institute-honors It may not be possible to consider nominations received after this date for the current year. However, those will be considered for the next year. Nominations in prescribed format may be submitted by past Distinguished Alumnus Awardees, Senate Members, Life Fellows, Alumni Foundations / Associations through their Presidents. Nominations must reach the Dean of Alumni Affairs latest by 31st March 2018, Saturday. Nominations received can be carried forward for 2 years with provisions for update by the concerned alumnus/alumna.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared Student Alumni Mentorship Programme - SAMP, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared Student Alumni Mentorship Programme - SAMP, IIT Kharagpur's post. It has been a week since the first phase of allotment and we hope that you are in touch with you mentor! The first phase was a huge success with the participation of about 450 students. We received a very positive response and both alumni and student registrations are still pouring in. We will have the second phase of allotment being done very soon. If you haven't registered yet, do it right now by going to http://www.mentorship.iitkgp.ac.in/mentee_registration. Stay tuned for more updates.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
An event where you learn to grow not only spiritually, but in the aspect of leading as well, is one way  to put the whole experience of the Summit. The Leadership Summit gives an array of teachings and lessons that gave thoughtful insights as to being an effective leader and team player. 
Students' Alumni Cell invites you to interact with 'KGPians' whose actions have inspired others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, on 24th March at 5:30 PM in Kalidas Auditorium.
Interact with our Leaders during Leadership Summit 2018 to know the secrets behind their story and the role IIT-KGP played in it.

#LeadershipSummit

HOMECOMING is a time of absolute delight for the Institute, for alumni and their families. Old friends reach out to one another, make new friends and walk together through the roads, bylanes of the campus and the halls of residence to relive a time gone by.
We have been receiving a lot of messages from the alumni of 2003 and 2008 batches requesting to postpone the dates of Homecoming 2018. 
We understand that this is a festival where you would wish to meet many of your batch mates and would not like to leave anyone out. To accommodate more and more alumni for the reunion, the Homecoming 2018 which was going to be held on 24th - 25th March 2018 has been postponed to be held from 17th - 19th August, 2018. 
To add to this joy, we will also have Class of 1998 gracing the occasion!
Looking forward to welcoming you back to your Institute.

HOMECOMING is a time of absolute delight for the Institute, for alumni and their families. Old friends reach out to one another, make new friends and walk together through the roads, bylanes of the campus and the halls of residence to relive a time gone by.
We have been receiving a lot of messages from the alumni of 2003 and 2008 batches requesting to postpone the dates of Homecoming 2018. 
We understand that this is a festival where you would wish to meet many of your batch mates and would not like to leave anyone out. To accommodate more and more alumni for the reunion, the Homecoming 2018 which was going to be held on 24th - 25th March 2018 has been postponed to be held from 17th - 19th August, 2018. 
To add to this joy, we will also have Class of 1998 gracing the occasion!
Looking forward to welcoming you back to your Institute.

A tree is known by it’s fruit and IIT Kharagpur is no different. It has always been driven and motivated by the achievements of it’s esteemed alumni and their accomplishments are the crowning glory of the Institute. Climbing the ladder to success at an exemplary pace, young alumni achievers are the greatest inspiration for all those who aspire to be great. IIT Kharagpur would like to take this opportunity to acknowledge and reward distinguished young graduates who have contributed significantly to their companies and communities while upholding the highest standards and values in everything they do. And what perfect occasion for the conferment of the awards than Homecoming? So, hurry now and submit the nominations at deanaa@hijli.iitkgp.ernet.in 
Kgp looks forward to be inspired by your passion and perseverance! :D

Students' Alumni Cell is all set to launch the next edition of it's initiative - Student Alumni Mentorship Programme with the aim to foster relationships between the students and the alumni and mend the broken link between them. “There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.” – Nelson Mandela

KGP: The place that is home away from home, the place we’ve spent some of the best years of our life at, the place which will forever be special for everyone who's been here. Still drenched in nostalgia from the reunion of the golden jubilee, silver jubilee and ruby jubilee batches, KGP is gearing up to host the batches of 2003 and 2008 on 24th - 25th March 2018 for a trip down the memory lane, to relive the same old days with the people who become family during the course of stay here. 

KGP awaits your presence ❤️ 

Register Now!

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavors to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to be implemented in near future to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. It was a very fruitful discussion between the deans and the student representatives of the IITs. Alongside SPARC - Students' PAN IIT Alumni Relations Cell also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: Recently all the Deans of 6 IITs of the Students’ Pan-IIT Alumni Relations Cell (SPARC) met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. It was a very fruitful discussion between the deans and the student representatives of the IITs. Alongside SPARC also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message: Over the years, Students' Alumni Cell has grown from an infant into what it is today. Prof Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, as the Dean of Alumni Affairs an International relations has always been supportive and helped take the cell to new heights. He has now passed on the baton to Prof Baidurya Bhattacharya and the Students' Alumni Cell takes immense pleasure in welcoming him and looks forward to adding more feathers to the cap of Alumni Cell under his guidance.

Ambulance target reached! :D

Thanks once again to the tremendous generosity of our alumni, our ambulance target of $35,000 has been achieved!

Further money raised will go towards the student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). Our goal is to reach $60,000.

A huge thanks to IITKGP Foundation for taking this initiative for the students.

Once again in tough times, the true spirit of KGP has emerged forth uniting the entire KGP family as a whole. 

#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle. 
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a  bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtCHqE

Days seem so slow and stagnant and we just can’t wait for the BIG days to knock on our doors, but when they finally arrive, they pass as if in a snap of our fingers everything we've been preparing for has already happened. The three days we have been waiting for, pass by as if in a flash, so fast that we can't believe our very eyes. So let us all savour the waiting and the craving. 
With just 25 days to go, we are all geared up to bring you the most enthralling 3 days of January. We are leaving no opportunity, to maximize this experience for you. Let's all take a Journey Back Home and unlock wonderful memories together!

PS- That's KGP from air around 30 years back! :D
